intro: Myosotis sylvatica proles alpestris, commonly known as the alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to cold climates.
